member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.Libraries.react_free_scrollbar.FreeScrollBar.fixed
member.summary: You can pass fixed to decide if handler's position: fixed or static. If fixed equals true, then the handler will overlap the content inside the scroller.

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.Libraries.react_free_scrollbar.FreeScrollBar.autohide
member.summary: Set true if you want a macOS style auto-hide scroller.

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.Libraries.react_free_scrollbar.FreeScrollBar.timeout
member.summary: The time length of the handler disappears. Default: 2000

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.Libraries.react_free_scrollbar.FreeScrollBar.tracksize
member.summary: The width of the vertical handler or the height of the horizontal handler. Default: 10px

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.Libraries.react_free_scrollbar.FreeScrollBar.start
member.summary:
The starting position of the scroll area, can be descriptive string or an object.
Options: "bottom", "bottom right", "top right", "right", {top: 20, left: 30}

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.Libraries.react_free_scrollbar.FreeScrollBar.browserOffset
member.summary: The browser scroll bar width. Default: "17px". It should fit for most browsers.

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.Libraries.react_free_scrollbar.FreeScrollBar.onScrollbarScrollTimeout
member.summary: This timeout adds a throttle for onScrollbarScroll. Default is 300. Set to 0 to remove throttle.

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_simple_code_editor.Editor.highlight
member.summary: json, js ...

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.start
member.summary: required can be a reference to a react ref to html element or string - an id of a DOM element.

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.end
member.summary: required can be a reference to a react ref to html element or string - an id of a DOM element.

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.startAnchor
member.summary: "auto" | "middle" | "left" | "right" | "top" | "bottom"

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.endAnchor
member.summary: "auto" | "middle" | "left" | "right" | "top" | "bottom"

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.color
member.summary: defines color to the entire arrow. lineColor,headColor and tailColor will override color specifically for line,tail or head

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.strokeWidth
member.summary: defines the thickness of the entire arrow. headSize and tailSize defines how big will be the head or tail relative to the strokeWidth

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.path
member.summary: can be one of: "smooth" | "grid" | "straight", and it controls the path arrow is drawn, exactly how their name suggest

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.curveness
member.summary: defines how much the lines curve. makes a difference only in path='smooth'

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.dashness
member.summary: can make the arrow dashed and can even animate. if true default values(for dashness) are chosen. if object is passed then default values are chosen except what passed.

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.animateDrawing
member.summary: can animate the drawing of the arrow using svg animation. type: boolean|number. if true animation duration is 1s. if number is passed then animation duration is number's value in seconds animateDrawing={0.1} will animate the drawing of the arrow in 100 milliseconds.

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.headShape
member.summary: you can customize the svg edges (head or tail) of the arrow. you can use predefined svg by passing string,one of "arrow1" | "circle" | "heart"

member.name: P:ReactWithDotNet.react_xarrows.Xarrow.tailShape
member.summary: you can customize the svg edges (head or tail) of the arrow. you can use predefined svg by passing string,one of "arrow1" | "circle" | "heart"
